org.apache.drill.exec.server.rest

Class TestRestJson

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.test.BaseTest
      • org.apache.drill.test.DrillTest
        • org.apache.drill.test.ClusterTest
          • org.apache.drill.exec.server.rest.TestRestJson

  • public class TestRestJson
extends ClusterTest
    Simple sanity test of the Drill REST client query JSON feature. In Drill 1.18, this test verified the original, buffered JSON output. In Drill 1.19, it verifies the streamed output (though only for a small query.) A large test is available below, but is normally disabled.

    Ad-hoc tests can be run by setting a breakpoint in one of the tests, then run the test in the debugger to start the REST server. Use your favorite browser-based tool:

    • Method: POST
    • Custom header: content-type: application/json
    • URL: http://localhost:8047/query.json
    • Body: 
      
 {"query": "SELECT * FROM cp.`employee.json` LIMIT 20",
  "queryType":"SQL"}
